p: According to the Council of Europe (2001) [ 44], the standard essential oil content of basil on the basis of dry weight should be 0.8% v/ w [ 45]. Overall, the yield and essential oil percentage was severely reduced by the water stress conditions. Medium water stress has been shown to increase secondary metabolites without negative effects on physiological activities, growth, and flowering [ 2, 46]. Increased essential oil content in Lippia citriodora through the application of balanced fertilization + biofertilizer + superabsorbent polymer as a water preservative in soil and mild stress has also been reported [ 47]. Mild water stress in arid and semi-arid regions demonstrated increased activity of phenylalanine ammonia lyase (PAL) and this protein synthesis shift toward phenol and final shift to essential oil.
